usefulItems: large bowl, cling film, slotted spoon, 2 large baking trays, baking paper, rolling pin, oven
title: Seafood Pizza

ingredients.content: 20 g groundnut oil, plus extra for greasing
400 g strong white bread flour, plus extra for flouring
150 g fresh mussels, cleaned and debearded

preparations.content: Place 50 g water, sugar and yeast in mixing bowl then warm <b>2 min/37°C/speed 2<b>. Meanwhile, grease a large bowl with oil.

Add oil, flour, remaining 170 g water, salt and squid ink (if using) then knead <b>2 min/<b>. Transfer dough to prepared bowl, cover with cling film then set aside to rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1-2 hours). Towards end of rising time, prepare topping.
Place oil and garlic in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>. Sauté <b>3 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Add prawns and cook <b>3 min/120°C//speed 1<b>. Using a slotted spoon, remove prawns to a bowl and set aside, keeping cooking liquid in mixing bowl.

Add tomatoes, basil and salt to mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and add mussels and clams. Cook <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove simmering basket with the aid of spatula and set aside. Blend sauce in mixing bowl <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>.
Preheat oven to 230°C and line 2 large baking trays with baking paper.
Divide risen dough into 2 balls then, on a floured work surface, roll out 2 circles (approx. Ø 30 cm each). Transfer pizza bases to prepared baking trays.
Spread tomato sauce, reserved cooked prawns, steamed mussels and clams and raw squid rings equally between pizzas then bake for 15 minutes (230°C). Serve hot, in slices.
